job_title: Teaching Assistant in La Crosse, WI
pros: Looks great on a resume. It’s very easy and you get familiar with the students and faculty.
cons: It can be slow some days.

review_title: Lack of Money Leading to Robotic Teaching & Overwork
job_title: Assistant Teaching Professor (9 Month) in La Crosse, WI
pros: Beautiful campus and the students are pleasant, even though many are cynical and disengaged due the the robotic teaching approach that is preferred by many. Great history. I hear it was an awesome place to work before the Wisconsin legislature froze tuition increases.
cons: High turnover with professors. Weak leadership in many departments. Low pay. There is little academic freedom, and many departments want professors to read the textbook off slides — probably due to high turnover, and to secure accreditation. They want you to give your life to the school for low pay and weak job security.

job_title: Math Tutor in La Crosse, WI
pros: Decent pay and flexible schedule
cons: No cons that I can think about

job_title: Career Advisor in La Crosse, WI
pros: Freedom to be creative, build connections to university/community
cons: Supervisors micromanage, terrible pay, don’t care about position retention/lots of turnover

job_title: enterprise application supporter in La Crosse, WI
pros: Educational community is interesting and fun. Enjoy the students and staff.

job_title: Associate Professor in La Crosse, WI
pros: Freedom to teach what you want

job_title: Teaching Assistant in La Crosse, WI

job_title: Facilities Assistant in La Crosse, WI
pros: I loved the boss and many of the people within the department. The boss was very kind and understanding. They were able to work around schedules and were flexible with changes.
cons: The location of the department was within another department that seemed to look down on us and there were many members within the department that were very underqualified and regularly underperformed.

job_title: Administrative Assistant II in La Crosse, WI

Great benefits 
predictable hours

Because it is a state school their is a lot of bureaucracy that can trickle down from the higher ranks

review_title: If you work in the Biology department, things we'll be frustrating but you'll love the people!

People great to work with

job_title: Professor in La Crosse, WI
pros: A smaller university offers more fulfilling teaching experiences. Lots of opportunities for advancement and growth. Benefits package is very good - especially if you stay in the Wisconsin system your full career.
cons: The Wisconsin System can be frustrating to work for. Pay alone is not competitive (but benefits help) and the organization is not very agile, even for academia. Good administrators on our campus help combat this but it's still an issue.

job_title: English Tutor in La Crosse, WI
pros: Diversity of papers seen every day keeps it interesting

review_title: Review for the COVE Graphics Garage

review_title: Great place to start your career

job_title: Peer Educator in La Crosse, WI

job_title: Asst in La Crosse, WI

job_title: Associate Professor in La Crosse, WI
pros: Great colleagues. La Crosse is a great place to live.
cons: Zero support from state, very little from university administration. I was a tenured professor at UW-La Crosse. The state cuts to education resulted in my take home pay falling for a number of years. Additionally, I faced salary compression and inversion compared to new hires with no experience.  As one of the few tenured members of my department, I had to take on more of the service work due to turnover of tenured and non-tenured faculty.  A disproportionate of my job ended up being service on search and screen (hiring) committees for new faculty. Meanwhile, the university had plenty of money to build new buildings.

review_title: Decent job, great students and location
job_title: Assistant Professor in La Crosse, WI
pros:
UW-La Crosse students are fantastic! Compared to other places I've worked, students, on the whole, are bright, motivated, and hard working. 
The balance of teaching, research, and service is pretty well-balanced: this job lets you do a bit of everything.
There is some support available for professional development through grants. 
La Crosse is a beautiful location with a low cost of living - so long as you enjoy winter!
cons:
Financial support for certain job functions that require travel can be difficult to obtain: it's assumed that faculty have the ability to pay out of pocket!
Salary, while fairly competitive, could be better.
Administration doesn't seem particularly good at mediating conflicts both in departments and between departments.

review_title: If higher ed is your calling, it's a great place to be
job_title: USA-2 in La Crosse, WI
pros: Great family-like environment within most offices. Wonderful co-workers, steady hours, and ability to strike a work-life balance. Supportive, kind, and encouraging direct supervisors. The #1 focus of university leadership is faculty, academic staff, and students.
cons: Pay and benefits are subject to the whim of the state government every two years. Pay is about 10-20% less than what you can expect in the local job market. Pension participation is mandatory; however, you have no say in how it is invested. The investment returns underperform  ALL stock market indices due to imposed restrictions.

job_title: Student Services Coordinator in La Crosse, WI
pros: Depends on unit - but overall, there is a friendly, collaborative feel on the campus; faculty are talented AND down to earth; students are above average academically and polite; the campus itself is beautiful.
cons: Some recent issues with administration making very public (and embarrassing) mistakes; pay is slightly lower than other universities, very limited opportunities for pay increases, and few chances for advancement; not a lot of support from state government (financial and otherwise).

review_title: I was a tutor and TA for the physics department.
job_title: Teachers Assistant/Tutor in La Crosse, WI
pros: You can work at school during the day, and in between your classes.  If you are a busy student, this is an ideal way to earn extra cash.
cons: You may have a hard time getting a lot of hours and it is also frustrating as you do not get paid very well.

review_title: State jobs are over hyped, benefits package is all that is worth it.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in La Crosse, WI
pros: Good health care and lots of vacation
cons:
-Dealing with Faculty who feel entitled and expect you to bow down to them.  They complain about pay when they are making almost a 100k and get 4 months off a year.
- You never get raises unless you are faculty

job_title: Lecturer in La Crosse, WI
pros: academic freedom, even after recent cuts still a good benefit package

job_title: Resident Assistant in La Crosse, WI
pros:
Incredibly fun environment 
Lovely staff to work with
Experienced and helpful management
Highly supportive with managing other activities and work
Free room and board
cons:
Room sharing as a RA originally wasn't great, but turned out to be a fantastic experience with my roomie!
AC in the old halls would've been nice during the hot months!
Otherwise great place to work! Thanks

review_title: Pretty much perfect; everything I could ask for
job_title: Reservations in La Crosse, WI
pros: Campus is great, so is the social atmosphere. Great academia too. UW-La Crosse has great values and staff and faculty. Many people interested in helping you succeed.
cons: Classes are tough, the work in certain areas can be annoying depending on what sector you work in but still worth it.

review_title: Overall good experience working at UW-L.
job_title: Peer Mentor in La Crosse, WI
pros: There was a good team atmosphere with a flexible work schedule for student work.  The pay was also higher than standard student work pay.
cons: At times it may be hard to find good times to work and you may get stuck working at nights instead of during the normal work hours.

job_title: Resident Assistant in La Crosse, WI
pros: Great compensations! Do this job for two years and you are basically paying for one less year of college! People are fantastic and I grew so much in leadership skills.
cons: Lots of work and big time commitment. You only get 12 days off the whole semester which makes it tough to go places.

review_title: Great things happening with very little state support
job_title: in La Crosse, WI
pros: Great students, quality faculty and staff.   Many employees are committed to making UWL the best educational experience for students.
cons: Political situation in the state of Wisconsin.  The support to the University system has been decreasing over the years.  Raises have been extremely small or nonexistent.

job_title: Residence Hall Director in La Crosse, WI
pros: Autonomy in some aspects of your work.
cons: The department is run by color-blind individuals who are not fit to support/coach folks of color. I am disappointed to have taken this job in the first place as I have felt as a token minority.

review_title: A faux kindness masking a scam
job_title: Resident Assistant in La Crosse, WI
pros:
Good coworkers
Relatively light workload
Option to not share your room
cons:
Horrible pay (with their estimated time spent working as an RA, the room&board and stipends make the hourly rate less than that of a Desk Assistant)
Ruthless, unsympathetic, and harsh upper management when enforcing small mistakes
No unionization

job_title: Resident Assistant in La Crosse, WI
pros: Its nice to be living on campus and never having to leave! Free food and free housing are a great benefit
cons: You work in the place that you live so you can never get away

review_title: The University in general is a nice place to work, but the MLG dept is very dysfunctional

review_title: Overall, a great seasonal/student position with a great University.

review_title: Manager understood our needs as a student
